We investigate the effect of an external heat source, which is modeled as \\( h(x, t) \\), added to specific points in the material at time \\( t \\).

If an initial heat distribution \\( u(x, 0) \\) is given and evolves according to \\( u_t = k \\Delta u \\) without any external influence, will the temperature distribution at time \\( T \\) be the same as if \\( h(x, t) \\) was added at time \\( t = 0 \\)?
Explanation: The addition of the heat source function \\( h(x, t) \\) modifies the initial conditions or continuously influences the distribution, leading to a change in the heat equation's solution over time. Without this addition, the evolution is purely diffusive and follows different dynamics.
